author: Staff Reporter
text:
Durga Prasad must appear before the investigating officer every day

The Madras High Court on Tuesday granted interim bail to S. Durga Prasad, Regional Commissioner (Chennai Region), Employees Provident Fund Organisation and six others who were arrested by the CBI in a corruption case. The CBI made the arrest on January 18 based on inputs that Mr. Prasad had demanded Rs.25 lakh as bribe for favouring a group running educational institutions in a case relating to subterfuge of wages paid to employees.

A case was registered under the provisions of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 and a SUV was confiscated by investigators.

When the bail pleas came up for hearing, Justice K. Kalyanasundram grated interim bail with a condition to appear before the investigating officer everyday until further orders.
title: High Court grants bail to PF Regional Commissioner
